results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Afghanistan, “Switzerland of Asia”, has about twelve million inhabitants and twelve cinemas. To one of these cinemas, the admission is one afghani. (Accorded the Award of Merit, Oberhausen).

results.title: Cinema
results.brief_description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.
results.description: Sebastian C. Schroeder’s sublime 1973 film ‘Cinema’, takes the physicality of film itself as a site of transformation, as celluloid itself metamorphoses into a magical realm for a group of Afghani children.

results.title: Cicada
results.creator_credit: Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cicada, or, as it is commonly known, the seven-year locust. In spring, the pupa emerges. Time-lapse photography shows us the transition from pupa to winged insect, including the shedding of the pupal shell. The winged insect lays eggs, from which young insects hatch and drop to the ground to begin their underground larval stage of development. In the spring, they will emerge in the pupal stage, and the life cycle will commence again. Narration by J.A. Hyslop.

results.title: Chromos
results.brief_description: Chromos is a computer-generated work which uses computational processes called ‘cellular automata’ to produce patterns which change over time. Cellular automata were conceived by Stanislaw Ulam and John von Neumann in the 1940s, and popularised by John Conway’s Game of Life in the late 1960s. Each cell - like the individual tiles that make up chromos - is a discrete system that follows its own simple rules. These rules govern the transitions of the tiles over time. Although both the tiles and the rules are simple, the overall behaviour of the system is complex and unpredictable. Chromos, like any beautiful design, invites contemplation, so rather than try to identify the mathematical rules at play, most viewers will happily lose themselves in the entrancing visual maze. The work engages aspects of behavioural and cognitive theories and theories of creativity. The human brain has evolved to seek meaning and so many viewers of cellular automata believe they are witnessing a much higher degree of intelligence and lifelike-ness than is implicit in the system itself. Conversely these systems also enable us to perceive that many aspects of human intelligence and creativity are perhaps nothing more than the outcome of simple but unpredictable behavioural processes.

results.title: Choices
results.brief_description: Shrinkage is the unaccountable disappearance of merchandise and can cost companies large amounts of money. “Shrinkage” may be due to external theft, administrative errors and internal theft. This program looks at the last of these three, through the experiences of two newly recruited shop assistants, and how they react to pressure to bend or break the rules. The program proposes four solutions to “shrinkage”. Be conscientious in every procedure, know the rules and follow them, don’t get involved with others’ weaknesses, although you should report suspicious behaviour and lastly avoid temptation yourself.

results.title: Chiostri e cortili
results.creator_credit: Ubaldo Magnachi and Istuto Nazionale Luce
results.brief_description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.

results.title: Chinese legends, gods and prophets
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and Mass Communications
results.brief_description: An introduction to oriental myth, religion and philosophy from the Shang Dynasty, 1766-l122 BC, to rites connected with ancestor worship as practised today in Taiwan.

results.title: China: changes from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.

results.title: China. Part 3. Life in the city
results.brief_description: Shows daily life in Peking, including scenes of schooling, shopping, religious ceremonies, and construction of new blocks of flats and a causeway. Describes the emphasis placed on health and fitness. Edited version of “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 2. Life in the country
results.brief_description: Reveals China as a land of contrasts. Shows sheep herding in the Sunkiang province, terraced hillsides planted with rice in the more temperate areas, inland lakes and rivers which provide fish, life in country towns, and harvesting activities. Edited from “China!”.
